poem:
Title: "Peace Hungers Within"

Ensemble of hearts, weary of war,
Strung like dew-kissed spider webs on the brink.
Do they not yearn, these threads of souls,
For peace that lies within the interim?
Beware the friend whose purpose derails,
Masked as gallantry, echoing chaos.
Extremist whispers pollute the quiet longing,
Yet hope sleeps, nestled between heartbeats,
Ever-renewing in the face of narcissist storms.
